description: From Middle English impetuous, from Old French impetueux, from Late Latin impetuōsus (“violent”), from Latin impetus (“attack, violence”).

adjectives.description: impetuous (comparative more impetuous, superlative most impetuous)

entries.meaning: Making arbitrary decisions, especially in an impulsive and forceful manner.
examples: But it was natural, that the impetuous, restless young artist should incline more to excess of strength than of delicacy in his playing.

entries.meaning: Characterized by sudden violence or vehemence.
examples: He stands, and views in the faint raysFar, far below, the torrent's rising surge,And listens to the wild impetuous roar
